title: Dear Riot: When The Champions That Abuse Liandry's Will Be Broken Next Patch
body:
Make sure you nerf Liandry's and not them.
It's not the champion's fault you made a fatal balancing error giving Liandry's Max HP damage.

The liandries change is a net nerf for him, and will be replaced by the new 'nomicon most of the time. The ramp has minimal effect for him due to his damage pattern, and while the % health change may be slightly better the loss of 15 magic pen is huge. Against the targets he will be tackling in lane and mid game it ranges from a 14 to 8% damage reduction (depending on exact levels and if he has sorc shoes yet or not), increased damage from liandries ticks can't make up for that loss on the rest of his rotation.
Should we see DoT champs become problematic, we'll likely be addressing Liandry's first.

Ok I'm going to list my assumptions and try to show my understanding of Liandrys. And if I'm approaching this wrong, please let me know.

Assumptions: ignoring the swap of magic pen for increase of 10%. Assuming rylais is built. Assuming mordes ult is the 10 second dot I read on a wiki. And just looking at liandrys damage as if the underlying spell damage didn't exist.

At full health mordes ult with new liandrys would do 20% max health with liandrys over the 10 seconds. With current liandrys he would do 33.5163% If all the damage was purely from liandrys. I couldn't find a beautiful equation for liandrys damage in terms of time so I had to do 10 calcs. (So I'm going to be lazy and not repeat this process for an under 50% health starting point) 

My main issue with your statements is you say "Oh Morde and brand are going to get this percent max health damage added on, it's OP" but for the most part that damage already exists currently. While I will concede that the argument that mordes ult and brands stuff will become alot stronger as an execute ability and that will be scary, it also means his damage to get you into execute range isn't going to be as high. 

In a different response to your post I mentioned plotting y=.02 vs y=.04 (1-x) to compare liandrys passive damage at points of health from 100-0. No body gave feedback on whether I was interpreting that correctly but it's causing me to view liandrys pbe as just a change instead of a nerf or buff. Anyway let me know your thoughts

Weeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeird. Almost seems like... it's not a nerf? But that would be crazy.

Honestly. It's really not that good on anyone but 5 or 6 champs. Ive been spamming on the pbe with it, and regular mages just plain suck with it. Brand and Morde can have their fun, but itll be at the expense of everyone else. 

As for the "not a nerf" think of it this way. Your target has to be half dead already to get any meaningful effect. Sure it may get you a kill here and there when its the only damage source left, but getting a tank to half health to begin with is the hard part. And against squishies, who cares? Theyll either explode or get saved with a million shields. Im actually willing to bet itll do less overall damage than the current iteration for most mages. It just plain feels bad to build.

Probably because the part that nobody's complaining about is whether it's good on 6 champions or not. The item was always best on DoT mages, so no shit it's going to be good on those mages again. The only thing anybody built it for was the magic pen - notice how not a single person is complaining about that removal.

The part that we don't like is that Liandry's went from an item to poke down tanks to an item that is basically just for killing squishies/giving % max health damage to DoT champs. Teemo now always does 10% of your health with a shroom - he doesn't even have to be present to kill you. Morde's ult now eats its target and is almost guaranteed to kill even without his Q. Brand will demolish entire teams. Malzahar's E can now get that sweet sweet reset effect to oblivion.

The item was **% current health** for a reason. The change is 100% fucked.

Spoiler alert, they introduce these overtuned items, then proceed to nerf the champions who abuse them. a few niche picks are still able to abuse the items even after the initial nerf, so riot goes all out and breaks their ankles. Then the item picks up traction on a few other champions unexpectedly and begins to really show how universally powerful it is. Riot proceeds to nerf the item. Now the champions reliant on it are so butchered without it they are in an abysmal state. The champions they counter run rampant, so riot buffs a select few into an OP state.
 
Suddenly we have come full circle, and the balancing is only in a worse state than before.
